thread.title: West bats away Heritage’s attempt at win
thread.title_full: West bats away Heritage’s attempt at win - PrepXtra Story

author: Dave Link
title: West bats away Heritage’s attempt at win
text:
West High School's football team clinched the No. 1 seed in Region 2-5A with some high drama Friday night.
Sophomore defensive back Juan Davis batted down a two-point conversion pass with no time left as the Rebels (7-1, 4-0) beat visiting Heritage 21-20.
Heritage (3-5, 3-1) pulled within one point at 21-20 as time ran out on Dustin Richardson's 8-yard screen pass to running back Colton Wright.
The Mountaineers were called for an excessive celebration penalty and the ball was moved back to the 18-yard line for the next play. Richardson's conversion pass was incomplete in the back of the end zone.
Heritage coach Tim Hammontree said he also would have gone for two points from the 3-yard line without the penalty.
"Up front, they were beating us up pretty good," Hammontree said. "We did a great job on defense on the goal line, but I guarantee you if we went for one, we were going into double and triple overtimes more than likely. We needed to win it outright and go home and get ready for next week."
Davis also had two interceptions and returned one for a touchdown.
Wright's 9-yard touchdown run gave Heritage a 7-0 lead midway through the first quarter.
West tied it on Zach Harshey's 61-yard TD pass to Jermaine Buchannon.
Wright's 76-yard TD run put Heritage up 14-7 with 1:33 left in the first quarter, but the Mountaineers went nine possessions without scoring again.
"It was a big effort by our defense tonight," West coach Jeff Harig said. "We continue to put them in situations that are not great, but certainly we're going to put this thing together in all three phases."
Davis intercepted a pass and returned it 22 yards for a touchdown to tie the game with 5:22 left in the third quarter. West took a 21-14 lead on Harshey's 30-yard TD pass to Demarcus Smith late in the third.
The Rebels had third-and-goal at the 1 midway through the fourth and were stopped for no gain on two rushing attempts.
"We couldn't punch it in on two attempts, and in hindsight, probably should have kicked the field goal," Harig said.
Dave Link is a freelance contributor.
